abstract.text: An encoder that writes GPU commands into a command buffer.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Donâ€™t implement this protocol yourself; instead you call methods on a
object to create command encoders. Command encoder objects are lightweight objects that you re-create every time you need to send commands to the GPU.
There are many different kinds of command encoders, each providing a different set of commands that can be encoded into the buffer.
protocol and an additional protocol specific to the kind of encoder being created.
Multiple graphics rendering tasks encoded in parallel.
While a command encoder is active, it has the exclusive right to append commands to its command buffer. Once you finish encoding commands, call the
method to finish encoding the commands. To write further commands into the same command buffer, create a new command encoder.

methods to put debug strings into the command buffer and to push or pop string labels used to identify groups of encoded commands. These methods donâ€™t change the rendering or compute behavior of your app; the Xcode debugger uses them to organize your appâ€™s rendering commands in a format that may provide insight into how your app works.

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An object for encoding commands that build or refit acceleration structures.
An interface you can use to encode GPU commands that copy and modify the underlying memory of various Metal resources.
A container that stores a sequence of GPU commands that you encode into it.
A configuration that customizes the behavior for a new command buffer.
The command buffer error codes that indicate why the GPU doesnâ€™t finish executing a command buffer.
Error codes that indicate why a GPU is unable to finish running a command buffer.
The domain for Metal command buffer errors.
An encoder that writes GPU commands into a command buffer.
The Metal device from which the command encoder was created.
Declares that all command generation from the encoder is completed.
Inserts a debug string into the captured frame data.
A string that labels the command encoder.
Pops the latest string off of a stack of debug group strings for the command encoder.
Pushes a specific string onto a stack of debug group strings for the command encoder.
An instance you use to create, submit, and schedule command buffers to a specific GPU device to run the commands within those buffers.
A configuration that customizes the behavior for a new command queue.
An interface for dispatching commands to encode in a compute pass.
An object that splits up a single render pass so that it can be simultaneously encoded from multiple threads.
An interface that encodes a render pass into a command buffer, including all its draw calls and configuration.
An encoder that encodes commands that modify resource configurations.
Discover how Metal executes commands on a GPU.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
